item.title: Ben add a quote by Ishmael Beah
item.description: "Some nights the sky wept stars that quickly floated and disappeared into the darkness before our wishes could meet them. " -- Ishmael Beah

item.title: Ben add a quote by Chris Abani
item.description: "What I've come to learn is that the world is never saved in grand messianic gestures, but in the simple accumulation of gentle, soft, almost invisible acts of compassion." -- Chris Abani

item.title: Ben add a quote by Stewart O'Nan
item.description: "You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved." -- Stewart O'Nan

item.title: Ben add a quote by Jonathan Ames
item.description: "I live for coincidences. They briefly give to me the illusion or the hope that there's a pattern to my life, and if there's a pattern, then maybe I'm moving toward some kind of destiny where it's all explained." -- Jonathan Ames

item.title: Ben add a quote by Leonora Carrington
item.description: "We went down into the silent garden. Dawn is the time when nothing breathes, the hour of silence. Everything is transfixed, only the light moves." -- Leonora Carrington

item.title: Ben add a quote by Joshua Slocum
item.description: "I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else." -- Joshua Slocum

item.title: Ben add a quote by Carolyn Forché
item.description: "The heart is the toughest part of the body. Tenderness is in the hands." -- Carolyn Forché

item.title: Ben add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "The surest defense against Evil is extreme individualism, originality of thinking, whimsicality, even—if you will—eccentricity." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Ben add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape." -- Louise Erdrich
